item.properties: Araru is an erect, smooth, dichotomously branched herbaceous perennial plant 1 - 2 meters high, growing from fleshy, fusiform rootstocks. Stems are slender. Leaf blades are lanceolate, attenuate-acuminate, 10 to 20 centimeters long, thin petioled, green and rounded at the base. Inflorescence is terminal, lax, divaricate, and few-flowered. Flowers are white, about 2 centimeters long.
item.usage: In the West Indies, roots used for poulticing poisoned and other wounds.||Mashed roots as plaster applied to areas of insect stings and spider bites.||Applied to the skin to soothe painful, irritated and inflamed mucous membranes.||Roots also poulticed for poisoned wounds.||The fresh juice is used as antidote for vegetable poisons.||Used to soothe the stomach and as a remedy for diarrhea, probably from its high starch content.
